verses.verse: Now <S%H6258><s%> these <S%H428><s%> are the judgments <S%H4941><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you shall set <S%H7760><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them.

If <S%H3588><s%> you buy <S%H7069><s%> an Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> servant, <S%H5650><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> he shall serve: <S%H5647><s%> and in the seventh <S%H7637><s%> he shall go <S%H3318><s%> out free <S%H2670><s%> for nothing. <S%H2600><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> he came <S%H935><s%> in by himself, <S%H1610><s%> he shall go <S%H3318><s%> out by himself: <S%H1610><s%> if <S%H518><s%> he were married, <S%H1166><s%> <S%H802><s%> then his wife <S%H802><s%> shall go <S%H3318><s%> out with him.

If <S%H518><s%> his master <S%H113><s%> have given <S%H5414><s%> him a wife, <S%H802><s%> and she have born <S%H3205><s%> him sons <S%H1121><s%> or <S%H176><s%> daughters; <S%H1323><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> and her children <S%H3206><s%> shall be her master's, <S%H113><s%> and he shall go <S%H3318><s%> out by himself. <S%H1610><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%> shall plainly <S%H559><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> I love <S%H157><s%> my master, <S%H113><s%> my wife, <S%H802><s%> and my children; <S%H1121><s%> I will not go <S%H3318><s%> out free: <S%H2670><s%>

Then his master <S%H113><s%> shall bring <S%H5066><s%> him to the judges; <S%H430><s%> he shall also bring <S%H5066><s%> him to the door, <S%H1817><s%> or <S%H176><s%> to the door <S%H4201><s%> post; <S%H4201><s%> and his master <S%H113><s%> shall bore <S%H7527><s%> his ear <S%H241><s%> through with an awl; <S%H4836><s%> and he shall serve <S%H5647><s%> him for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> sell <S%H4376><s%> his daughter <S%H1323><s%> to be a maidservant, <S%H519><s%> she shall not go <S%H3318><s%> out as the menservants <S%H5650><s%> do. <S%H3318><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> she please <S%H7451><s%> <S%H5869><s%> not her master, <S%H113><s%> who <S%H834><s%> has betrothed <S%H3259><s%> her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: <S%H6299><s%> to sell <S%H4376><s%> her to a strange <S%H5237><s%> nation <S%H5971><s%> he shall have no <S%H3808><s%> power, <S%H4910><s%> seeing he has dealt deceitfully <S%H898><s%> with her.
And if <S%H518><s%> he have betrothed <S%H3259><s%> her to his son, <S%H1121><s%> he shall deal <S%H6213><s%> with her after the manner <S%H4941><s%> of daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> he take <S%H3947><s%> him another <S%H312><s%> wife; her food, <S%H7607><s%> her raiment, <S%H3682><s%> and her duty of marriage, <S%H5772><s%> shall he not diminish. <S%H1639><s%>
And if <S%H518><s%> he do <S%H6213><s%> not these <S%H428><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> to her, then shall she go <S%H3318><s%> out free <S%H2600><s%> without <S%H369><s%> money. <S%H3701><s%>
He that smites <S%H5221><s%> a man, <S%H376><s%> so that he die, <S%H4191><s%> shall be surely put to death. <S%H4191><s%>

And if <S%H834><s%> a man lie <S%H6658><s%> not in wait, <S%H6658><s%> but God <S%H430><s%> deliver <S%H579><s%> him into his hand; <S%H3027><s%> then I will appoint <S%H7760><s%> you a place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> he shall flee. <S%H5127><s%>

But if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> come presumptuously <S%H2102><s%> on his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> to slay <S%H2026><s%> him with guile; <S%H6195><s%> you shall take <S%H3947><s%> him from my altar, <S%H4196><s%> that he may die. <S%H4191><s%>
And he that smites <S%H5221><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> or his mother, <S%H517><s%> shall be surely put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
And he that steals <S%H1589><s%> a man, <S%H376><s%> and sells <S%H4376><s%> him, or if he be found <S%H4672><s%> in his hand, <S%H3027><s%> he shall surely be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
And he that curses <S%H7043><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> or his mother, <S%H517><s%> shall surely be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> men <S%H582><s%> strive <S%H7378><s%> together, and one smite <S%H5221><s%> another <S%H7453><s%> with a stone, <S%H68><s%> or <S%H176><s%> with his fist, <S%H106><s%> and he die <S%H4191><s%> not, but keeps <S%H5307><s%> his bed: <S%H4904><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> he rise <S%H6965><s%> again, and walk <S%H1980><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> on his staff, <S%H4938><s%> then shall he that smote <S%H5221><s%> him be quit: <S%H5352><s%> only <S%H7535><s%> he shall pay <S%H5414><s%> for the loss <S%H7674><s%> of his time, <S%H7674><s%> and shall cause him to be thoroughly <S%H7495><s%> healed. <S%H7495><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> his servant, <S%H5650><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his maid, <S%H519><s%> with a rod, <S%H7626><s%> and he die <S%H4191><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> his hand; <S%H3027><s%> he shall be surely punished. <S%H5358><s%>
Notwithstanding, <S%H389><s%> if <S%H518><s%> he continue <S%H5975><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> or <S%H176><s%> two, he shall not be punished: <S%H5358><s%> for he is his money. <S%H3701><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> men <S%H582><s%> strive, <S%H5327><s%> and hurt <S%H5062><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> with child, <S%H2030><s%> so that her fruit <S%H3206><s%> depart <S%H3318><s%> from her, and yet no <S%H3808><s%> mischief <S%H611><s%> follow: <S%H1961><s%> he shall be surely punished, <S%H6064><s%> according as the woman's <S%H802><s%> husband <S%H1167><s%> will lay <S%H7896><s%> on him; and he shall pay <S%H5414><s%> as the judges <S%H6414><s%> determine.
And if <S%H518><s%> any mischief <S%H611><s%> follow, <S%H1961><s%> then you shall give <S%H5414><s%> life <S%H5315><s%> for life, <S%H5315><s%>
Eye <S%H5869><s%> for eye, <S%H5869><s%> tooth <S%H8127><s%> for tooth, <S%H8127><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%> for hand, <S%H3027><s%> foot <S%H7272><s%> for foot, <S%H7272><s%>
Burning <S%H3555><s%> for burning, <S%H3555><s%> wound <S%H6482><s%> for wound, <S%H6482><s%> stripe <S%H2250><s%> for stripe. <S%H2250><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> the eye <S%H5869><s%> of his servant, <S%H5650><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the eye <S%H5869><s%> of his maid, <S%H519><s%> that it perish; <S%H7843><s%> he shall let him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> for his eye's <S%H5869><s%> sake. <S%H8478><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> he smite <S%H5307><s%> out his manservant's <S%H5650><s%> tooth, <S%H8127><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his maidservant's <S%H519><s%> tooth; <S%H8127><s%> he shall let him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> for his tooth's <S%H8127><s%> sake. <S%H8478><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%> gore <S%H5055><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a woman, <S%H802><s%> that they die: <S%H4191><s%> then the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be surely stoned, <S%H5619><s%> and his flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall not be eaten; <S%H398><s%> but the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be quit. <S%H5355><s%>

But if <S%H518><s%> the ox <S%H7794><s%> were wont <S%H5056><s%> to push <S%H5056><s%> with his horn <S%H5056><s%> in time <S%H8543><s%> <S%H8032><s%> past, <S%H8032><s%> and it has been testified <S%H5749><s%> to his owner, <S%H1167><s%> and he has not kept <S%H8104><s%> him in, but that he has killed <S%H4191><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a woman; <S%H802><s%> the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned, <S%H5619><s%> and his owner <S%H1167><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> shall be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> there be laid <S%H7896><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> him a sum <S%H3724><s%> of money, then he shall give <S%H5414><s%> for the ransom <S%H6306><s%> of his life <S%H5315><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> is laid <S%H7896><s%> on him.

Whether <S%H176><s%> he have gored <S%H5055><s%> a son, <S%H1121><s%> or <S%H176><s%> have gored <S%H5055><s%> a daughter, <S%H1323><s%> according to this <S%H2088><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> shall it be done <S%H6213><s%> to him.

If <S%H518><s%> the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall push <S%H5055><s%> a manservant <S%H5650><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a maidservant; <S%H519><s%> he shall give <S%H5414><s%> to their master <S%H113><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> and the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned. <S%H5619><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall open <S%H6605><s%> a pit, <S%H953><s%> or <S%H176><s%> if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall dig <S%H3738><s%> a pit, <S%H953><s%> and not cover <S%H3680><s%> it, and an ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> an ass <S%H2543><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> therein; <S%H8033><s%>

The owner <S%H1167><s%> of the pit <S%H953><s%> shall make it good, <S%H7999><s%> and give <S%H7725><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to the owner <S%H1167><s%> of them; and the dead <S%H4191><s%> beast shall be his.

And if <S%H3588><s%> one man's <S%H376><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> hurt <S%H5062><s%> another's, <S%H7453><s%> that he die; <S%H4191><s%> then they shall sell <S%H4376><s%> the live <S%H2416><s%> ox, <S%H7794><s%> and divide <S%H2673><s%> the money <S%H3701><s%> of it; and the dead <S%H4191><s%> ox also <S%H1571><s%> they shall divide. <S%H2673><s%>

Or <S%H176><s%> if it be known <S%H3045><s%> that the ox <S%H7794><s%> has used to push <S%H5056><s%> in time <S%H8543><s%> <S%H8032><s%> past, <S%H8032><s%> and his owner <S%H1167><s%> has not kept <S%H8104><s%> him in; he shall surely pay <S%H7999><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> for ox; <S%H7794><s%> and the dead <S%H4191><s%> shall be his own.
